page.title: 08FOLK CUSTOMS IN DURHAM
page.content: Nearly every year since 1871,in July, the{Durham Miners' Gala}has been celebrated on the racecourse.The pit bands and lodge banners lead the miners into the City. Political speeches are followed by a Cathedral service. The{Regatta}is held in June on the Wear.Rowing club,school and University crews have competed since 1884. The{Cathedral Choir}sings from the tower on Royal Oak Day (May 29th.)to the N.E.and W.but not S.,which was the site of the Battle of Neville's Cross. University students hold a{Rag Day each February, and pancakes are supposed to fall from the mouth of the Sanctuary Knocker on Shrove Tuesday. { Folk Day,}with Morris and country dancing in the streets, is in June and the{City Folk Festival}each August.
